item.title: Samsung Unveils ‘Folding Handheld’ Concept Called Flex Gaming
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/samsung-flex-gaming-foldable-handheld/

Samsung has taken to the stage at MWC 2025 to unveil a stunning lineup of technology ranging from new OLED television sets to immense gaming monitors – and everything in between. The set included an incredible 500 Hz OLED monitor and a gorgeous 240 Hz OLED laptop – and a conceptual handheld gaming device that folds in the middle.

This is following on from Samsung’s success with foldable mobile phones and tablets, and it’s a natural enough progression point, but is anyone asking for it?

Foldable Gaming Experiences

At MWC 2025, Samsung revealed Flex Gaming, a conceptual device with a 7.2-inch screen that folds down the middle for ease of storage. It was revealed at the showcase, and a demo was held, but it wasn’t confirmed if the device was usable.

It looks as though it boasts a relatively traditional layout featuring a pair of joysticks and a d-pad, but there’s a recess on either side of the device. This is to allow the joysticks to ‘enter’ the device when it’s collapsed, which means it takes up even less space.

It was sat alongside a Steam Deck and Razer Blade 16, and all these devices were being used to run KRAFTON’s ‘popular games’, which included InZOI, a realistic competitor to The Sims.

Tech aficionados flocked to the event to check out Samsung’s new 77-inch QD-OLED televisions, as well as a 31.5-inch QD-OLED monitor, both of which boast utterly remarkably visuals and colour expression.

One of the more bizarre elements of the Samsung lineup was the Flexible Cabinbag, a bag-like device that unfolds into an 18.1-inch display. It can be compacted to fit inside a briefcase, and it comes equipped with – you guessed it – an OLED screen. That’s the order of the day where Samsung is concerned.

Do you think you’d invest in a folding handheld gaming device? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: Rockstar Games to Acquire Video Games Deluxe And Will be Renamed to Rockstar Australia
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/rockstar-games-video-games-deluxe/

Rockstar Games will acquire Video Games Deluxe and rename the studio to Rockstar Australia, it has been announced.

In the press release announcement (via businesswire), it was said that Rockstar Games will acquire the studio, but did not disclose the sum.

The press release reads:

Rockstar Games® is proud to announce the acquisition of Video Games Deluxe, the Sydney-based development studio. The studio will be renamed Rockstar Australia. Video Games Deluxe has worked with Rockstar Games on some of its most memorable titles, including the 2017 re-releases of L.A. Noire, L.A. Noire: The VR Case Files, and most recently, on upgrades to Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy – The Definitive Edition for iOS and Android, Netflix, and modern consoles.

“After working together closely over many years, we are excited to have Video Games Deluxe join the team as Rockstar Australia,” said Rockstar Games Head of Publishing, Jennifer Kolbe.

Rockstar Games’ relationship with the Video Games Deluxe team began with founder Brendan McNamara’s former studio, Team Bondi, and the creation of the critically acclaimed and groundbreaking detective thriller, L.A. Noire.

“It’s been an honor to work closely with Rockstar Games this past decade,” said Video Games Deluxe founder Brendan McNamara. “We are thrilled to be a part of Rockstar Games and to continue our efforts to make the best games possible.”

item.title: Pokémon Champions Release—Platforms & Everything we Know
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-champions-release/

Whisper it, but the release of Pokémon Champions instantly gives a Pokémon Stadium feeling. The Pokémon Company surprised everyone with its announcement, but now it’s out in the wild, it’s time to prepare yourself for battle.

Older Pokémon fans will remember the glory of Pokémon Stadium 1 and 2. The larger-than-life titles focused on the series’ core combat and head-to-head encounters. Exhilarating battles brought to life in huge arenas with flashy visuals and sizzling sound effects. The last 25 years have seen a slew of Pokémon titles, but none similar to Stadium.

Say hello to Pokémon Champions—a seemingly spiritual successor to the Stadium years. It’s an entirely new AAA release, and its launch might surprise you for a couple of reasons.

Do we Know When Pokémon Champions is Coming Out?

Pokémon Champions doesn’t have a release date or an estimated window. All we know for sure is it’s “Now in Development,” and updates on its progress will arrive as and when they are ready.

The February 2025 Pokémon Presents showcase is where we first learned of Pokémon Champions. A new Pokémon title was rumored to be shown off during the presentation. But it was expected to be another remake or perhaps a remaster.

Instead, a full trailer for Pokémon Champions was revealed—showing off its glitz, glamor, and gameplay. You can check out the debut announcement trailer right here.

All Pokémon Champions Platforms

Pokémon Champions is a multi-platform release for Nintendo Switch and mobile.

It’s not just an exclusive Nintendo release and that’s it. Pokémon Champions is also coming to mobile platforms too. The official YouTube trailer announcement’s description confirms as much.

“Look forward to cross-platform battles alongside your favorite Pokémon on Nintendo Switch and mobile, with a variety of different modes available for your desired experience,” it says.

For now, we presume it’s the Nintendo Switch, but a Switch 2 release is likely on the cards as well.

What is Pokémon Champions?

Even though a lot of the content is quite cryptic, there’s a definite Pokémon Stadium feeling with big-time battles in large arenas again. It also looks like Pokémon can turn into Tera Types too.

It’s also confirmed Champions “Will feature familiar mechanics such as Pokémon types, Abilities, and moves, creating an environment conducive to rich and varied strategies for new and experienced Trainers alike.”

We’re sure we’ll learn much more about Pokémon Champions as time passes.

What are your initial impressions of Pokémon Champions? Does The Pokémon Company have another winner on its hands? Is it another Gym badge to pin up somewhere for the company? Can Champions capture the feeling of what made Pokémon Stadium so magical? Drop a comment below.
